info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 23 at 10:56PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Throckmorton County through 1130 PM CDT... At 1056 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near The Intersection Of Us- 380 And Highway 222, or 9 miles south of Millers Creek Reservoir, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Throckmorton, Elbert, Us-183 Near The Throckmorton- Baylor County Line and The Intersection Of Us-380 And Highway 222. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for west central Texas.
